data.enText: things that you throw away because you no longer want or need them

data.chText: 垃圾场 / 堆 / 倾倒处

data.enText: The streets were littered with rubbish.
something that you think is of poor quality
I thought the play was rubbish!
Do we have to listen to this rubbish music?
data.chText: 我们一定要听这样差劲的音乐吗？

data.enText: comments, ideas, etc. that you think are stupid or wrong
You're talking a load of rubbish.
to criticize sb/sth severely or treat them as though they are of no value

Rubbish is the usual word in BrE for the things that you throw away because you no longer want or need them. Garbage and trash are both used in NAmE . Inside the home, garbage tends to mean waste food and other wet material, while trash is paper, cardboard and dry material.
data.chText: 在英国英语中，rubbish为常用词，指垃圾、废物。garbage和trash均用于北美英语。生活垃圾中，garbage多指废弃的食物和其他湿物质，而trash则指废弃的纸、硬纸板和干物质。

data.enText: In BrE , you put your rubbish in a dustbin in the street to be collected by the dustmen . In NAmE , your garbage and trash goes in a garbage/trash can in the street and is collected by garbage men/collectors .
data.chText: 在英国英语中，垃圾为rubbish，街上的垃圾桶为dustbin，清除垃圾的工人叫dustman。在北美英语中，垃圾为garbage和trash，街上的垃圾桶为garbage/trash can，清除垃圾的工人叫garbage man/collector。

data.enText: Refuse is a formal word and is used in both BrE and NAmE . Refuse collector is the formal word for a dustman or garbage collector.
data.chText: refuse为正式用语，用于英国英语和北美英语均可。refuse collector为dustman或garbage collector的正式说法。

word_means: 贬低， 把……说得一文不值

means: 贬低， 把……说得一文不值

ex.enText: Tom went to dump the garbage.
ex.chText: 汤姆去倒垃圾。

ex.enText: Garbage pollutes our rivers and lakes.
ex.chText: 垃圾污染我们的河川湖泊。

synonyms.bx: 多指生活中的有机废料，如废纸、包装盒、剩饭剩菜或变质的食物等。

ex.enText: The ditches had filled up with mud and debris.
ex.chText: 沟渠中塞满了淤泥和垃圾。

ex.enText: Was the debris removed in your presence?
ex.chText: 你在现场时，碎渣等垃圾是否清除掉了？

synonyms.bx: 指某处堆积的垃圾或某种材料无用的碎渣、碎片等。

ex.enText: There is a heap of junk in the corner.
ex.chText: 墙角有一堆废旧杂物。

ex.enText: He threw away all the junk in the boot of his car.
ex.chText: 他把汽车行李箱中所有废旧杂物都扔掉了。

synonyms.bx: 指没有用处、毫无价值的废旧物品。

ex.enText: Don't drop litter anywhere.
ex.chText: 请不要乱扔垃圾。

ex.enText: There were piles of litter in the streets.
ex.chText: 街道上垃圾成堆。

synonyms.bx: 尤指在公共场所散落于地、有碍观瞻的废弃物。

ex.enText: They burnt up all the garden rubbish.
ex.chText: 他们将花园中的垃圾全部烧掉了。

ex.enText: The dustman comes once a week to collect the rubbish.
ex.chText: 垃圾工每周来收一次垃圾。

ex.enText: Oh God, he's got so much rubbish on his desk!
ex.chText: 天哪，他桌上有那么多垃圾！

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，指扔掉的食物、废纸等；也可指任何不再使用而应该扔掉的东西，但作此义解时多用于非正式文体。

ex.enText: household/industrial waste
ex.chText: 家庭垃圾/工业废料

ex.enText: Put all the waste in this bag.
ex.chText: 把所有垃圾放进这只袋子里。

ex.enText: They disposed of the city's waste in the sea.
ex.chText: 他们把城里的垃圾倒入海中。

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，多指已无使用价值的材料或陈旧的、破损的物品，也可指任何被丢弃之物。

ex.enText: Stop your nonsense!
ex.chText: 别胡扯！

ex.enText: You're telling us nonsense.
ex.chText: 你是在跟我们瞎扯。

ex.enText: What he said is sheer nonsense.
ex.chText: 他的话纯粹是胡说。

synonyms.bx: 指荒唐、愚蠢的话语、看法等。

ex.enText: Forget all that bullshit and listen to me!
ex.chText: 别讲那些废话，听我说！

ex.enText: That's bullshit! I don't believe a word of it.
ex.chText: 屁话！我一个字也不信。

synonyms.bx: 较粗俗用词，指完全不真实的蠢话。

ex.enText: Don't talk rubbish.
ex.chText: 别胡说八道。

ex.enText: His book is a load of rubbish.
ex.chText: 他的书简直是废话连篇。

synonyms.bx: 从本义“垃圾”引申指毫无价值的话或想法。

ex.enText: I won't believe in all that twaddle about fate.
ex.chText: 我才不信那些关于命运的蠢话呢。

ex.enText: His essay is nothing but twaddle.
ex.chText: 他的文章完全是一派胡言。

synonyms.bx: 指说的或写的无聊的东西。

tr: worthless material that is to be disposed of

example.ex: They had piled most of their rubbish into yellow skips.
example.tran: 他们把大多数的垃圾堆到了黄色的废料桶里。

value.def: Rubbish consists of unwanted things or waste material such as used paper, empty tins and bottles, and waste food.

value.boxr_value: in AM, usually use 美国英语通常用garbage, trash

example.ex: He described her book as absolute rubbish.

value.def: If you think that something is of very poor quality, you can say that it is rubbish .

example.ex: These reports are total and utter rubbish.

value.def: If you think that an idea or a statement is foolish or wrong, you can say that it is rubbish .

example.ex: He was rubbish at his job...
example.tran: 他的工作做得差劲极了。

example.ex: I tried playing golf, but I was rubbish.
example.tran: 我试过打高尔夫球，但是我的球技太烂了。

value.def: If you think that someone is not very good at something, you can say that they are rubbish at it.
value.tran: 极不擅长的;非常差劲的

example.ex: Five whole pages of script were devoted to rubbishing her political opponents...
example.tran: 整整5页讲稿都是对她的政敌的诋毁。

example.ex: Officials have simply rubbished all positive ideas.
example.tran: 官员们对所有的正面意见一律否决。

value.def: If you rubbish a person, their ideas or their work, you say they are of little value.
value.tran: 贬低;诋毁;将…说得一文不值

value.boxr_value: in AM, use 美国英语用 trash

value.boxu_tran: 在英国英语中，rubbish最常用来表示丢弃的废物，但是在美国英语中garbage和trash更为常用，如：the smell of rotting garbage (腐烂垃圾的臭味)，She threw the bottle into the trash (她把瓶子扔进了垃圾堆)。garbage和trash有时也在英国英语中使用，但仅限于非正式语体和比喻用法：I don't have to listen to this garbage (我不需要听这些废话)，The book was trash (这本书简直是垃圾)。
value.boxu_usage: In British English, rubbish is the word most commonly used to refer to waste material that is thrown away. In American English, the words garbage and trash are more usual. ...the smell of rotting garbage... She threw the bottle into the trash. Garbage and trash are sometimes used in British English, but only informally and metaphorically. I don't have to listen to this garbage... The book was trash.
